results.title: Charlie needs a cloak
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Charlie is a shepherd. He has a cosy house, a big hat, a crook, a flock of fat sheep - and a tattered cloak. In the springtime, Charlie decides to make himself a new red cloak. He shears his sheep and fashions his new garment from the wool. This animated film, sparked by a whimsical Italian tarantella musical score, follows the process of making woollen cloth into clothing with charm and wry humour. The conclusion will delight - and not altogether surprise - the young viewer. Written and animated by Tomie de Paola from his book of the same name.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin: The Fireman/Caught in a Cabaret
results.brief_description: In the “Fireman”, Charlie Chaplin stars as a lazy and inefficient fireman.(1916). Also features “Caught in a Cabaret” (1914). Rated: G

results.title: Charlie Chaplin: The Adventurer/the Cure
results.brief_description: Charles Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads” and worked all over England and parts of Europe throughout his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned to that country again in 1912 to 1913 where he was seen by Mack Sennett and joined the Keystone company for $150 per week. This cassette features: “The Cure” (1917) and “The Adventurer” (1917).

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 03
results.brief_description: This compilation video features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “Easy street”: Charlie becomes a policeman and imposes his own brand of order on chaotic Easy Street. “The Immigrant”: Charlie meets a beautiful girl on board a ship. After many hilarious hardships they rescue each other and live happily ever after. “The Cure”: Our hero deposits the contents of his liquor bottle into the curative spa at a Sanatorium. “The Adventurer”: The hectic experiences of an escaped convict, with Charlie starring as the convict.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: This compilation features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “The Pawnshop”: Chaplin stars as the pawnbroker’s assistant. “The Rink”: Chaplin as the waiter. “The Floorwalker” and “One A.M.”: Chaplin as the drunk.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London, of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight, he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads”, and worked throughout England and parts of Europe during his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned again in 1912-13 when he joined the Keystone company. This compilation features four of his short films, The Vagabond”, “The Fireman”, “The Count” and “Behind the Screen.

results.title: Charlie Chalkman's chalk catcher challenge
results.brief_description: This interactive game is designed for younger children. Set on a chalkboard, the main character Charlie (controlled by the player) tries to catch the falling chalks and fruits to achieve a high score. The player must also avoid the falling erasers, which if touched, rub Charlie out to end the game.

results.title: Charlie's day
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson and Martin Defalco
results.brief_description: A warning, though in comic style, that pure oxygen is a hazard, and a serious one, when handled without care in hospitals and elsewhere. Charlie, a hospital orderly, creates havoc just in moving a cylinder from storeroom to bedside. The film demonstrates how oxygen makes substances more combustible, even so unlikely a material as steel wool. A film for staff training wherever oxygen is used.

results.title: Charley Squash goes to town
results.brief_description: An animated film, based on an Indian comic-strip character created by Duke Redbird, telling the story of a young Indian who leaves the reserve to make his way in the city. Eventually he returns to the reserve and the ways of his people. Animation: Yvon Mallette, Marie Claire Berube. Voice and narration: Isaac Beaulieu. (Award: Philadelphia)

results.title: Charley says. Vol. 01
results.creator_credit: Video Network and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Presented here is a collection of over seventy Public Information Films that were made between 1959-1975. All the favourite animated characters are here: Charley the ginger moggy whose safety-conscious nature is a perfect companion for the kids, Jo and Petunia the environmentally unfriendly picnickers and Tufty the animated puppet squirrel who gets mum to help him across the road. This collection of colourful and varied animations were a big part of the 70’s culture (especially) and helped disseminate a range of community, health and safety messages. This large collection helps encapsulate the values of its day and helps to illustrate the changing values within our society.
